inclusion.criterion: Adult male patients with age > 18 years old
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subject has elevated serum PSA level above 4ng/ml
inclusion.label: met
met
inclusion.evidence: He is a candidate for urethral catheterization and TURP.

exclusion.criterion: Patient with recent urinary tract infection within 6 weeks prior to PSA testing and urine collection.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient with recent urethral instrumentation, such as Foley catheter insertion, cystoscopy etc, within 6 weeks prior to PSA testing and urine collection.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient with consumption of 5 alpha reductase inhibitors in past 6 months.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient did not receive any surgery for prostatic pathology
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patient refused or unable to provide consent for the study
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 63-year-old man presenting to the Emergency Department with a history of acute urinary retention in the past 2 days.
